comments:
I downloaded the BIRT run time (BIRT 2.2 M4 ) from http://download.eclipse.org/birt/downloads/ and imported birt.war 
into a jDeveloper project. JDeveloper 10.1.2 from http://www.oracle.com/tools/jdev_home.html.
When I run the sample app (index.jsp and view Example ? test.rptdesign), I get the appended exception. 

It seems to work fine if I use the HOTSPOT jvm instead of the OJVM. 
(Right click on Project Properties -> Profiles -> Development -> Runner )
Also, this problem did not show up with the older version of BIRT (2.0 milestone 5 build)

Is jDeveloper/OC4J supported with BIRT 2.2? Is there any other setting that I may need to do?

Thanks
Avinash

(In reply to comment #0)
I did some further testing with jDeveloper 10.1.3 and it works fine with both hotspot and ojvm. On jDeveloper 10.1.2 it works fine with hot spot and fails with ojvm ( I tested this with BIRT 2.1.1).

> I downloaded the BIRT run time (BIRT 2.2 M4 ) from
> http://download.eclipse.org/birt/downloads/ and imported birt.war 
> into a jDeveloper project. JDeveloper 10.1.2 from
> http://www.oracle.com/tools/jdev_home.html.
> When I run the sample app (index.jsp and view Example ? test.rptdesign), I get

> 
> It seems to work fine if I use the HOTSPOT jvm instead of the OJVM. 
> (Right click on Project Properties -> Profiles -> Development -> Runner )
> Also, this problem did not show up with the older version of BIRT (2.0
> milestone 5 build)
> 
> Is jDeveloper/OC4J supported with BIRT 2.2? Is there any other setting that I
> may need to do?
> 
> Thanks
> Avinash

We do not have committers working on the JDeveloper env.  Is it correct that BIRT 2.2M4 works on jDeveloper 10.1.3 but not jDeveloper 10.1.2.

(In reply to comment #2)

This is correct.  Please note that jDeveloper 10.1.3 is using JRE 1.5 (5.0) where as jDeveloper 10.1.2 is using jRE 1.4.2. So, for somebody who is not willing to move to JRE 1.5 this may not be an option.

Also, in jDeveloper 10.1.2, the developer has the option to use the hotspot jvm OR the Oracle jvm - ojvm. BIRT 2.2M4 work fine with hotspot. The problem is with ojvm. Again here, jDeveloper 10.1.2 does not support debugging with hotspot JVM. So, this is not really a workable option.

So to summarize, BIRT 2.2M4 works on jDeveloper 10.1.3 but not jDeveloper 10.1.2.  

FYI. We have been using BIRT 2.0M5 build in the jDeveloper / Oracle server environment with no major problems. The problem is with the newer version of BIRT and even here I believe the problem is with new OSGI platform / OJVM compatability .

Thank you .

> We do not have committers working on the JDeveloper env.  Is it correct that
> BIRT 2.2M4 works on jDeveloper 10.1.3 but not jDeveloper 10.1.2.  
>
